original: Almqvist, Ernst Olof Daniel, civilingenjör, Göteborg, f. 19/10/82 i Motala av dir. Sven A. o. Agnes Norrman. G. 16 m. Signe Berteisen. Barn: Eva Margareta f. 17, Sven Arvid 21. — Studiex. i Gbg Oi, civ:ing:ex. v. CTH (skeppsbyggn.) 04. Stud:resa t. USA 15. Prakt. v. olika varv o. verkst. i Sv:e, Danm., Tyskl. o. Engl. 04-08, verkst :ing. v. A-B Götaverken i Gbg 08-12, driftsing. där 12-18, chef f. A-B A. Bonthrons försäljn :kont. i Gbg 18-22, dir. f. A-B Specialmaskiner i Gbg sed. 22. Ordf. i styr. f. sistnämnda föret. sed. 34, led. av styr. f. S/S Aeolus 10-15, GKSS 16-21, led. av Tekn. samf. nd sed. 32, led. av fören. Gbgs fasta försv. o. av Sv. tekn :fören. sed. 18. Skr.: reseberätt. i Tekn. Tidskr.
translated: Almqvist, Ernst Olof Daniel, engineer, Gothenburg, born October 19th, 1882 in Motala, son of director Sven A. and Agnes Norrman. Married to Signe Berteisen for 16 years with two children: Eva Margareta, born in 1917, and Sven Arvid, born in 1921. He passed his final exams in Gothenburg and obtained his engineering degree from CTH (specializing in shipbuilding) in 1904. He went on a study trip to USA in 1915. He worked practically at various shipyards and workshops in Sweden, Denmark, Germany, and England from 1904 to 1908. He worked as an engineer at A-B Götaverken in Gothenburg from 1908 to 1912, then as a production manager from 1912 to 1918, and as a director for A-B A. Bonthron's sales office in Gothenburg from 1918 to 1922. He has been the director of A-B Specialmaskiner in Gothenburg since 1922, and the chairman of the board for the same company since 1934. He was a member of the board for the S/S Aeolus from 1910 to 1915, and a member of the board for GKSS from 1916 to 1921. He was also a member of the Technical Society and the Gothenburg Defense Association, as well as the Swedish Association of Engineering, from 1918. He has written travel essays in the Technical Journal.
